EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:

Darnel Inc. has a goal of 100% compliance with the requirements of the EPA Risk Management Requirements for a flammable material stored in excess of 10,000 pounds. It is the policy of Darnel Inc. that each employee has a safe and healthful workplace. It is also the policy of Darnel Inc. that each employee follows all safety rules and safe work practices. Darnel has worked closely with the local fire department to develop an emergency response plan for the site that has been integrated into the local community response plan

FACILITY DESCRIPTION:

The Darnel Facility at 1809 Airport Road, Monroe manufactures polystyrene foam packaging. Polystyrene pellets are melted in an extruder, mixed with liquid iso butane under pressure and extruded through a die to atmospheric pressure producing foam. The iso butane is stored under pressure on site at a maximum inventory of 136,000 pounds. The process is covered by the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OSHA) for Process Safety Management (PSM) of hazardous chemicals, 29CFR1910.119

SUMMARY OF HAZARDS:

Iso butane has a boiling point of 11?F and a flash point of -116?F making this material extremely flammable. The flammable range is 1.4% - 8.3% in air and iso butane vapor is almost twice the density of air. It will pool on the ground as a result of a storage leak and will evaporate. The vapors will stay close to the ground and collect in low places as it dissipates. Liquid iso butane contact with the skin may cause frost bite because of evaporative cooling.

WORST CASE SCENARIO:

The worst case scenario is the instantaneous release of the tank contents with the formation of a vapor cloud and a vapor cloud explosion. The end point (1 psi overpressure) is an area with a radius of 0.4 miles from the center of the iso butane storage tank. 59 people reside within this area as well as South Piedmont Community College. Census data was provided by Landview 6. RMP COMP* was used to determine off site consequences

LTERNATIVE CASE SCENARIO:

The alternative case scenario is a pipe leak on the pipe outlet from the storage tank that would result in a leak of 2200 pounds/minute for ten minutes. The explosive end point for this case is less than 0.1 miles. There are no residents or public receptors in this area.





PREVENTION PROGRAM:

EMPLOYEE PARTICIPATION:

Darnel has developed policies and procedures for Employee Participation and has initiated implementation. Operations people will be involved in upcoming PHA reviews as well as operating procedure updates, Management of Change activities and Pre Start Up Safety Reviews.

TRAINING:

All employees have been trained through on the job training as well as OSHA classes. Procedures are in place for the training and orientation of new employees as well as retraining of employees at least every three years. Training will take place over the next twelve months in the areas of MOC, PSSR, Mechanical Integrity and PHA as required by job description. A confirmation form for acknowledgement and understanding of training has been initiated.

MANAGEMENT SYSTEM:

A written management system for the implementation and sustainability for RMP has been developed and implemented. A PSM/RMP coordinator has been assigned and ownership of specific parts of RMP has been established. A schedule for the review of procedures, retraining of personnel, PHA review and completion of compliance audits has been established.

OPERATING PROCEDURES:

Operating Procedures have been written for normal start up, running, shutdown, emergency shutdown and start up after emergency shutdown. Operating limits and consequences of deviation have been included in the procedures.

PROCESS SAFETY INFORMATION:

All Process Safety Information has been collected including MSDS, P& IDs, Operating limits; interlocks and process safety relief sizing calculations have been collected and filed in a central location for access by all employees.

MECHANICAL INTEGRITY:

A mechanical i

ntegrity program has been developed and is in place. The plant was started up in April 2007 and all equipment was inspected to ensure that it was installed and set up according to design requirements. Mechanical inspection programs have been set up to meet code requirements and critical instrumentation will be tested every six months according to vendor instructions. All semi annualinspections of the iso butane storage tank have been completed.

INCIDENT INVESTIGATION:

A procedure for incident and accident investigation has been developed including reporting requirements to regulatory agencies. 

EMERGENCY RESPONSE:

Emergency Procedures have been developed for minor and major releases of iso butane that include shutdown procedures and on and off site notifications. Assembly areas have been identified. The plan has been reviewed with the City Of Monroe fire department and incorporated in to the Local Community Emergency Response Plan. A procedure for emergency response exercises has been established in collaboration with the City Of Monroe fire department.

PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS

A PHA review of the process was completed 8/1/08. P&ID?s are up to date. HAZOP methodology was used for the review.
